title: Solicitor ranted racist abuse at mum and toddler on train saying they shouldn’t be in first class
text:
Opinion RACE HATE LAWYER Solicitor ranted racist abuse at mum and toddler on train saying they shouldn’t be in first class 
When Sanaa Shahid asked him not to shout at her son Zayn, he replied with a barrage of racist abuse BY JOHN SHAMMAS and GEMMA MULLIN 4th February 2017, 10:20 am A HIGH-FLYING solicitor racially abused a mum in front of her toddler son on a train – saying she should not be in first class and telling her to go “back to her country”. 
Loudmouth Alexander MacKinnon, 47, had been drinking while on a train from London Euston to Glasgow on December 29 last year when the incident took place in a first class carriage. Facebook Alexander MacKinnon ranted racist abuse at a mother and son for sitting in first-class @sanaashahid 4 Sanaa Shahid was travelling on a train with her four-year-old son Zayn from London to Glasgow when the incident happened 
He began shouting at Sanaa Shahid and her four-year-old son Zayn on the Virgin West Coast Mainline train, telling him to be quiet. 
And when she asked MacKinnon, of Mansionhouse Road, Glasgow, not to shout at her son he replied with a barrage of racist abuse, a court heard. 
MacKinnon began demanding to know where she “came from”, and why “didn’t she go back there”. 
He also insisted that she should not be in first class. After being left in tears, the victim reported him to staff and the train manager told MacKinnon that he would be taken off the train at Carlisle and met by police to be questioned. 
However MacKinnon, who is originally from London and studied at exclusive Milton Abbey School in Dorset, continued the rant. 
He screamed that the Glasgow-born lawyer should not be in the country, and was wasting police time. 
MacKinnon even continued to be abusive and racist about Sanaa during a police interview. 
Sanaa had been visiting her husband Aftab, 36, who was working in London, when the vile incident happened on the 2.30pm London Euston to Glasgow Virgin train. @sanaashahid 4 Sanaa praised the train manager on the 2.30pm train from London to Glasgow on December 29 
She told the Daily Record : “This man started behaving aggressively to my son, telling him to shut up. 
“I said to him that my son hadn’t done anything and then the abuse began. 
“I’ve lived in Scotland all my life and nothing of this nature has ever happened to me.” 
She said that there were about a dozen passengers in the carriage who sat in silence. 
It was only when train staff overheard her telling MacKinnon he was being racist that the manager intervened. 
She has since praised the manager on the Virgin train on her Twitter page. 
MacKinnon appeared at Carlisle magistrates court on Tuesday where he admitted a racially aggravated public order offence. 
He reportedly booked into a hotel in Gretna for his court appearance and shamelessly reviewed it online, praising the “very friendly staff” and “fantastic breakfast”. PA:Press Association Archive Alexander MacKinnon has been slapped with a fine after dishing out the sick abuse 
MacKinnon’s social media “likes” include Donald Trump, the BNP and and the far-right English Defence League. 
Investigating officer PC Mark Mellenthin said: “The victim was visibly distressed and shaken by MacKinnon’s frightening racist outburst. 
“Thankfully the train manager stepped in before the abuse escalated. 
“People like MacKinnon must understand that abusive, racist behaviour like this has no place on the railway and will not be tolerated. 
“Everyone has the right to travel in safety without fear of abuse like this, violence or intimidation. 
“When it does happen we will do everything in our power to bring them before the courts. 
“Hopefully MacKinnon’s substantial fine will make him think twice before unleashing such vitriol on other members of the public.” 
In court he was fined £1,154 after pleading guilty to a Racially Aggravated Public Order offence. We pay for your stories! Do you have a story for The Sun Online news team? Email us at or call 0207 782 4368
